column2: NEVADA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: NV

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column6: a divided highway is ahead.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 2. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column8: be ready to hit a reindeer.

column2: 3. If you stop along the road at night:
column6: turn off all your lights.
column8: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column10: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column6: one-way street ahead.

column2: 5. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column6: Diamond

column2: 6. This sign indicates:
column6: a church zone ahead.

column2: 7. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column6: turn left into the one-way road.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 8. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 9. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column10: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 10. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 11. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: The road ends ahead
column10: A road joins from the right

column2: 13. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: Can help improve vehicle stability.
column8: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 14. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column6: brown and white.

column2: 15. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 16. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 17. If an officer believes you are driving under the influence and asks you to take an alcohol or drug test:
column4: you can refuse to be take the test as stated by the Implied Consent Law.
column6: you can refuse to be tested only if it is your first offense.
column8: you cannot refuse to take the test.

column2: 18. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column6: Lap and shoulder belt only

column2: 19. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 20. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column6: minimum speed

column2: 21. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 22. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 24. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 25. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column6: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column8: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.

column2: 26. A steady green light at intersections means:
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column8: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 27. This sign means:
column4: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 28. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 29. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column6: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column8: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column10: get off the highway as quickly as possible.

column2: 30. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
column6: at an intersection.

column2: 31. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column6: Only if the light is green.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.

column2: 32. Aggressive drivers:
column4: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.
column6: run stop signs.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column6: Keep right

column2: 34. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column6: red; red

column2: 35. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 36. With conventional brakes, the correct way to stop in an emergency situation where traction is lost and the car slides is by pumping the brakes.
column6: True

column2: 37. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: at an intersection with a stop sign.
column6: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column8: where there is a red light.

column2: 38. This road sign is:
column6: a guide sign.

column2: 39. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.
column6: Driving within the range.

column2: 40. Alcohol causes:
column6: loss of concentration.

column2: 41. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column6: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 42. To enter a freeway:
column4: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column6: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column8: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column10: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.

column2: 43. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a right turn ahead.
column6: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column10: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 44. When they see this sign, drivers:
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column10: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 45. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column6: parking lights.

column2: 46. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 47. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column6: finish crossing the street.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 48. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column6: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column10: share the lane with the motorcycle.

column2: 49. Regulation signs normally are:
column6: green rectangles.

column2: 50. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
column6: hand signals
